snippet: Under the settlement, nearly two million Americans could benefit from mortgage relief from the nation’s biggest banks.
abstract: State and federal authorities announce details of their $26 billion mortgage settlement with big banks; nearly two million Americans could benefit from $20 billion in mortgage relief, with another $1.5 billion set aside for people who lost their homes to foreclosure; experts question whether the settlement will do much to stabilize the housing market, pointing out that half the nation's mortgages are owned by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, and are not covered.

byline.original: By NELSON D. SCHWARTZ and JULIE CRESWELL

lead_paragraph: Under the settlement, nearly two million Americans could benefit from mortgage relief from the nation’s biggest banks.

headline.seo: Mortgage Plan Gives Billions to Homeowners, But With Some Exceptions
headline.main: Mortgage Plan Gives Billions to Homeowners, but With Exceptions
headline.print_headline: Mortgage Plan Gives Billions to Homeowners, but With Exceptions
